description: From Middle English moderly, from Old English mōdorlīċ (“motherly, maternal”), from Proto-Germanic *mōdērlīkaz (“motherly, maternal”), equivalent to mother +‎ -ly.

adjectives.description: motherly (comparative more motherly, superlative most motherly)

entries.meaning: Befitting a mother; warm, caring, nurturing, protective, loving.

adverbs.description: motherly (comparative more motherly, superlative most motherly)

entries.meaning: In a way pertaining to, befitting, or of a mother.
